page.title: 14MITCHELDEAN PUBLIC LIBRARY
page.content: Before 1983, the nearest public library was in Cinderford, but in the spring of that year a new library was opened in the centre of Mitcheldean. It was built on a piece of waste ground which had resulted from earlier widening of the High Street. It is built of reconstructed stone which is an excellent match with the Old Red Sandstone of some of the older town centre buildings. There is plenty of space inside, and a good selection of books. There is an attractive childrens section with facilities for games such as chess, and the entrance lobby has a display area for local history, forthcoming events, and jobs available in the area. Cassettes and tapes can also be borrowed, and there is a picture lending service.
